title: Remembering 1945

abstract: It wasn't only sad memories that led Jude to serve her country but a memory of seeing the men of the Lighthorse in uniform formed her desire to join up later in life .
description: Jude remembers her childhood and realises so much of her young life involved war and trauma. Visiting her father in the repatriation hospital she saw first-hand the effects of WWII on those that returned. Most of the men in her family went to WWII and she recalls how the family never recovered from the loss of one cousin at the hands of the Japanese as a POW.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2002738; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans; Active; 2011
